poem:
Title: In Cups, Stirred and Stirring

The serpent of commerce slithers,
Starbucks, her scales, fiercely resist union's call.
Yet, under February's frosty veneer,
A thaw, a relenting and whispered agreement.
To seek common soil, to sow seeds of dialogue.
In-person, in silence, bargaining resumes,
A testament to the strength of collective voice,
A question posed to other giants.
Who shall follow down this respectful, bitter path?
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘Huge breakthrough’ in Starbucks union talks – which other US firms will follow? For more than two years Starbucks has fought fiercely against unionization. Now the company appears willing to come to the bargaining table. Starbucks and its union made a surprise joint announcement in late February: they had agreed to seek “a constructive path forward” on “the future of organizing and collective bargaining”. On Tuesday, the Starbucks union said it would resume in-person bargaining". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
